name.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: ChatGPT Anti Clickbait News- Generate less biased headlines

short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Generate a detailed and accurate headline from a news article and replace the origional headline.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Tired of sensationalized and clickbait headlines that don't match the article? 

This extension allows you to quickly transform sensationalized or uninformative headlines into more neutral, factual summaries, allowing you to stay informed without a bias. Free to use and designed to works on all news sites.

ðŸ—² Generates non-biased, descriptive, and neutral headlines or summaries from news articles.
ðŸ—² Works seamlessly on popular news websites including CNBC, CNN, Fox News, and more.
ðŸ—²Easily generate new headlines with a single click from the extensionâ€™s popup interface.

How It Works:

    1.  Add "ChatGPT News De-Sensationalizer" to your Chrome browser.
    2.  Enter your OpenAI API key in the extension popup to enable the AI-powered features.
    3. Visit your favorite news websites as usual.
    4. Click the extension icon and hit the "Generate Headline" button to see the new version of the articleâ€™s headline.
    5. Read the article with a better idea of the content.

Disclaimer:

ChatGPT News De-Sensationalizer is designed to help provide more neutral and context driven headlines for news articles. However, it is important to remember that the generated headlines are based on the content provided and processed by the model, and may not always capture the full context or nuances of the original article. 

Additionally, ChatGPT has limitations and may not always produce perfect results. Be aware of potential inaccuracies or oversights. Always read the full article to understand the complete context and details before forming any opinions or conclusions.

Privacy:

The OpenAI API key you provide is stored locally on your device. The API key you provide is used to access OpenAI's services. The content of the articles you read is temporarily sent to OpenAI's servers to generate the non-biased headlines. This process involves your API key being used by OpenAI to perform the necessary computations and return the generated headline.The data sent to OpenAI is subject to their privacy policy and terms of service.
